intro: Plagiogyria wilhelmensis, commonly known as the Wilhelm's plagiogyria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and covered in fine hairs. Plagiogyria wilhelmensis is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
